page.title: 11ST JOSEPH'S R.C. CHAPEL.
page.content: St Joseph's R.C. Primary School's new chapel cost Â£100000. The altar is made of granite and weighs four tons! Our priest is called Fr. Kennedy. Our chapel has got stained glass windows. The Baptismal Font is made of granite and so is the lectern. Bishop Swindlehurst officially opened our chapel. He poured oils over the altar to bless it. The roof of the chapel comes to a big point with a cross made of metal on the top. The roof has a giant sky light. Hanging from the roof is a big metal ring of light bulbs. Behind the altar is a wooden cross which was hand carved and cost Â£100. A giant shutter separates the chapel from the school hall and blue velvet curtains hang in front of it. The shutter lifts up when we have mass. There's a tabernacle inside the chapel a cry room, changing room and office.
